catch_line: Glass Bottles On Public Property Prohibited.
full_text:
GLASS BOTTLES ON PUBLIC PROPERTY PROHIBITED.
	(Added by Ord. No. 159,636, Eff. 3/5/85.)

	No person shall carry any glass beverage bottle, whether empty or not, into any public street, or portion of any public street, or onto any other public property when such street or property is being temporarily used for the conducting of a community civic event or local special event of community interest with respect to which approval to use the street or property for said event has been given by the City of Los Angeles by permit, City Council resolution or otherwise, and where barricades or other devices or City personnel have been placed or stationed in the public street or streets and at any other public way along the perimeter of the area being so used. The provisions of this section shall not apply when beverages are sold or dispensed within the area in glass bottles, nor shall the provisions of this section apply to any glass bottle brought into the area which contains any drug or medicine or which is designated for dispensing milk, juice or other beverages to babies or infants, or which is intended to be used, or the contents of which is intended to by used, in the preparation or seasoning of food.

5.catch_line: Assault Weapons – Sale Or Possession Prohibited.

6.catch_line: Use Of Bows And Arrows Prohibited.

8.catch_line: Glass Bottles On Public Property Prohibited.

10.catch_line: Carry Knives Or Daggers In Plain View Prohibited.

12.catch_line: Duty To Report Theft Or Loss Of Firearms; Exemptions.

14.catch_line: Sale Of Ammunition Clips And Similar Devices.

15.catch_line: Sale Or Purchase Of More Than One Handgun Within A Thirty Day Period Prohibited.

18.catch_line: Possession Of Gun Parts In Airports.

19.catch_line: Sale Of Large Caliber Firearms Prohibited.

20.catch_line: Sale Of Ammunition For Large Caliber Firearms Prohibited.

21.catch_line:
False Or Secret Compartments In Vehicles To Hide
Firearms Or Destructive Devices.

dublin_core.Title: Glass Bottles On Public Property Prohibited.

plain_text:
LOS ANGELES MUNICIPAL CODE

GLASS BOTTLES ON PUBLIC PROPERTY PROHIBITED. (§ 55.08)

  GLASS BOTTLES ON PUBLIC PROPERTY PROHIBITED.
	(Added by Ord. No. 159,636, Eff. 3/5/85.)	No person shall carry any glass
beverage bottle, whether empty or not, into any public street, or portion of any
public street, or onto any other public property when such street or property is
being temporarily used for the conducting of a community civic event or local
special event of community interest with respect to which approval to use the
street or property for said event has been given by the City of Los Angeles by
permit, City Council resolution or otherwise, and where barricades or other
devices or City personnel have been placed or stationed in the public street or
streets and at any other public way along the perimeter of the area being so
used. The provisions of this section shall not apply when beverages are sold or
dispensed within the area in glass bottles, nor shall the provisions of this
section apply to any glass bottle brought into the area which contains any drug
or medicine or which is designated for dispensing milk, juice or other beverages
to babies or infants, or which is intended to be used, or the contents of which
is intended to by used, in the preparation or seasoning of food.

The provisions of this section shall not apply when beverages are sold or dispensed within the area in glass bottles, nor shall the provisions of this section apply to any glass bottle brought into the area which contains any drug or medicine or which is designated for dispensing milk, juice or other beverages to babies or infants, or which is intended to be used, or the contents of which is intended to by used, in the preparation or seasoning of food.
